summary: Build STEP 1 visuals: a full-screen cinematic theatre/stage scene with fixed centered hub logo and background silhouette logo, now bound to the uploaded “-1” asset filenames only (logo2-1.png, jacques-johnson-1.png, kream-kuntree-1.png, rl-stafford-1.png), with strict asset validation and fail-loudly missing-asset overlay.
architectural_notes: Strict STEP 1 scope only: do not add ECG, heartbeat audio, carousel, artist cards, redirects/links, or any additional UI beyond specified visuals.
Asset handling: must use exact filenames; no substitutions or placeholders; missing asset triggers a blocking full-screen overlay with exact message.
Add an explicit asset rescan step that outputs/list detected project files before continuing (for verification of required exact filenames).

Asset filename bindings updated: MUST use only the detected “-1” files (logo2-1.png, jacques-johnson-1.png, kream-kuntree-1.png, rl-stafford-1.png). Do not reference logo2.png or any original filenames; no substitutions/placeholders.
Support an explicit asset refresh/resync flow for the draft/preview: re-check accessible project image assets and resync when assets are not accessible; never substitute or use placeholders.
Hub logo asset rebinding: remove and reinsert the centered hub logo image using exactly logo2-1.png; no layout/styling changes.
Path correction: reference logo asset as "logo2-1.png" (no leading "/") for both center hub logo and background silhouette; no layout/styling changes.
Runtime path safeguard: on page load, normalize src for known required assets by stripping leading "/" when present; do not change any layout/styling.
known_issues: Publish/build domain name is invalid: "step-1:-cinematic-theatre/stage-scene-with-centere" fails constraint (must be 5–50 chars and only letters/numbers/hyphens).
Preview is rewriting image src to absolute root paths (e.g., "/logo2-1.png"), breaking asset loading; needs normalization to relative paths.

existing_features.title: Implement strict startup asset validation for the following exact filenames: logo2.png, jacques-johnson.png, kream-kuntree.png, rl-stafford.png. If any of these assets cannot be found/loaded, render a full-screen blocking overlay that says exactly: “MISSING ASSET: [filename] — DO NOT SUBSTITUTE”. Do not render placeholders or substitute alternative assets.

Create a full-screen cinematic theatre/stage environment (visuals only) with a pure black base background and readable/brighter rendering (avoid crushed blacks). The scene must include: heavy theatre curtains on the left and right with deep folds; a visible auditorium feel with subtle seats/rows on both sides; a central aisle/walkway; warm aisle lights along the walkway; visible overhead rigging/truss with hanging spotlights; and subtle volumetric light beams (soft haze) suitable for performance lighting.

Render logo2.png as a large, dominant, fixed centerpiece exactly centered in the viewport. Ensure it is layered above the curtains/scene (correct z-index). Add a very faint halo/orbit ring around the centered hub (thin, feathered, low opacity).

Add a huge background silhouette/shadow version of logo2.png behind the environment and center hub logo. It must be a single, non-tiled instance sized to approximately 140–180% of viewport width, very low opacity, dark, and still recognizable.

After startup asset validation completes, present a blocking “Asset Scan Results” screen that lists each required asset filename (logo2.png, jacques-johnson.png, kream-kuntree.png, rl-stafford.png) and whether it was successfully detected/loaded, and require the user to explicitly continue before the theatre scene renders. If any required asset is missing, keep the existing strict missing-asset behavior (full-screen overlay with the exact message) and do not allow continuing.
Update the centered hub logo to load ONLY from the exact filename "/logo2-1.png" (do not reference "/logo2.png" anywhere for the center hub logo).
Update the background silhouette logo to load ONLY from the exact filename "/logo2-1.png" (do not reference "/logo2.png" anywhere for the background silhouette).

Update strict startup asset validation and the Asset Scan Results listing to require and validate ONLY these exact filenames: "logo2-1.png", "jacques-johnson-1.png", "kream-kuntree-1.png", "rl-stafford-1.png". Do not validate or reference the non-suffixed filenames (e.g., "logo2.png").

Add an in-app “asset refresh” capability that re-evaluates availability/loadability of the exact required image assets (logo2-1.png, jacques-johnson-1.png, kream-kuntree-1.png, rl-stafford-1.png) for the current draft/preview without substituting images or generating placeholders.

When re-evaluating assets for refresh/resync, avoid stale/cached responses by forcing a fresh retrieval attempt for each required file (while still requesting the exact same filenames) so the preview reflects the current project assets.

Provide a “resync the draft/preview with project assets” action when assets cannot be accessed, implemented as a safe client-side resync (e.g., hard reload of the preview) that keeps strict missing-asset enforcement and does not introduce substitutions or placeholders.

Add a user-accessible “Resync Preview” action that rebuilds the preview using the current project assets (without changing any required asset filenames), so a user can force a clean reload even when no assets are currently missing.

Ensure that performing a preview resync (and/or asset refresh) cannot leave the app in a stale state: after resync/refresh, the app must re-run the Asset Scan Results gating step and require the user to explicitly Continue again before rendering the theatre scene.

Resolve the publish/build failure caused by an invalid domain/slug string (currently reported as `step-1:-cinematic-theatre/stage-scene-with-centere`). Ensure that the value used for publish domain/slug always satisfies the constraint: length 5–50 characters and contains only letters, numbers, and hyphens.

If the app or project metadata surfaces a human-editable project name/title that can influence the publish domain/slug, add a validation/sanitization step so disallowed characters are either rejected with a clear English error message or automatically converted to hyphens before attempting publish.

Perform an asset rebinding step for the centered hub logo image by forcing the hub logo element to be removed from the DOM and reinserted, while continuing to load ONLY from the exact filename "/logo2-1.png". This must not change any layout, sizing, positioning, z-index, halo ring styling, or any other visual styling.

Update the centered hub logo image reference in frontend/src/components/CenteredHubLogo.tsx to use "logo2-1.png" instead of "/logo2-1.png" (path correction only). Do not change any layout, sizing, positioning, z-index layering, halo/orbit ring styling, or the existing asset rebinding behavior (the key-based unmount/remount).

Update the background silhouette logo image reference in frontend/src/components/BackgroundSilhouetteLogo.tsx to use "logo2-1.png" instead of "/logo2-1.png" (path correction only). Do not change opacity, size, positioning, or any styling.

Provide a user-visible “Rebuild Preview” action (English text) that forces a full preview rebuild/reload after image path updates, so the updated image paths are definitely used. This should be the same underlying behavior as the current hard reload resync (i.e., a full page reload), and must re-run the strict required-asset validation and show the “Asset Scan Results” gating screen again before rendering the theatre scene.

Ensure the app does not use absolute root paths (no leading "/") for any of the required image assets: logo2-1.png, jacques-johnson-1.png, kream-kuntree-1.png, rl-stafford-1.png. Update all relevant code paths (including asset validation/loading) to use relative asset references only (e.g., "logo2-1.png" not "/logo2-1.png").

Add a runtime safeguard that runs on initial page load: scan all elements in the document, and if an image src attribute (via getAttribute("src") and/or the current resolved src) starts with "/" and the filename matches one of these known assets (logo2-1.png, jacques-johnson-1.png, kream-kuntree-1.png, rl-stafford-1.png), rewrite the DOM attribute to the same filename without the leading slash (e.g., "/logo2-1.png" -> "logo2-1.png").
